snippet: The European Union has fined eight financial institutions a combined 1.7 billion euros ($2.3 billion) over charges they manipulated two benchmark interest rates. | A major grudge match on Wall Street flared up recently. | Regulators have reached a...
abstract: The European Union has fined eight financial institutions a combined 1.7 billion euros ($2.3 billion) over charges they manipulated two benchmark interest rates. | A major grudge match on Wall Street flared up recently. | Regulators have reached a tentative agreement to complete the Volcker Rule, which is aimed at Wall Street risk-taking. | Charles W. Ergen is using a legal loophole in a bid to control a rival.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: European Union Imposes Fines for Rate-Fixing
